venice.hub.utils

Class Configuration

  • java.lang.Object
    • venice.hub.utils.Configuration

  • public class Configuration
extends java.lang.Object
    Parses command line arguments and provides the configuration data for the other components.

    This class is a singleton structure.

    Author:
    Jens Eickmeyer, Oliver Eickmeyer

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Configuration.Connection
      The possible connections for data sources and targets.

    • Field Detail

      • FILENAME_XIO_RSB

        public static final java.lang.String FILENAME_XIO_RSB
        The default name for the xml file containing definitions of how to map XIO codes and data types for RSB. This file will be loaded when XIO-RSB-mapping is needed, but the user have not provided the relevant command line argument (-x). For example, the RSB-to-Disk-mode requires the XIO-RSB-mapping.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DIRNAME_PROTOBUF

        public static final java.lang.String DIRNAME_PROTOBUF
        The default name of the folder containing the protobuf classes for RSB. This folder will be used, when RSB-modes are used, but the user have not provided the relevant command line argument (--protobuf).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • FILENAME_CLASS_MATCH

        public static final java.lang.String FILENAME_CLASS_MATCH
        The default name for the xml file containing definitions of how to match classes between RSB and IIO. This file will be loaded when class matching between IIO- and RSB- datatypes is necessary, but the user have not provided the relevant option (--classMatcher). For example, the RSB-to-IIO-mode requires class matching.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        Returns:
        returns true if no error has occurred while parsing arguments

      • getMulticastAdress

        public java.lang.String getMulticastAdress()
        Returns the multicast address that is used by InstantIO network operations. It is returned as a String representation (i.e. "224.21.12.68").
        Returns:
        multicast address for InstantIO

      • getMulticastPort

        public int getMulticastPort()
        Returns the actual used multicast port that is used by InstantIO network operations.
        Returns:
        port for multicast

      • getLogFilePath

        public java.lang.String getLogFilePath()
        Returns the name of the log file that is used for DISK connections. If the target is DISK, then the log file is the output file where VeniceHub write the XIO line representations of incoming data. If the source is DISK, then the log file is read and parsed by VeniceHub to replay the data.
        Returns:
        name of the file for DISK-modes (may include path)

      • getHeaderLines

        public int getHeaderLines()
        Returns the number of header lines in a log file. Those lines will be ignored when reading from a log file.
        Returns:
        number of headerLines to be ignored

      • isSensorPredefined

        public boolean isSensorPredefined()
        Returns true if sensor slots are predefined. This happens only, when a slot file was read and parsed into a list of predefined sensor slots. VeniceHub will then create only those slots, instead of creating slots dynamically. Use getPreScopes() to get access to the list of predefined sensor slots.
        Returns:
        true if sensor slots are predefined; false otherwise.

      • getPreScopes

        public java.util.ArrayList<venice.lib.AbstractSlot> getPreScopes()
        Returns a list of predefined sensor slots.
        Returns:
        list of sensor slots, or null if no slots has been predefined.

      • isRSBToXIO

        public boolean isRSBToXIO()
        Returns true if the RSB-to-XIO option is used. With this option, all data will first be converted into a String containing an XIO line representation of that data. Then this String object is send to RSB, instead of the data itself.
        Returns:
        true if RSB-to-XIO option is used, false otherwise

      • isRSBStringXIOLine

        public boolean isRSBStringXIOLine()
        Returns true if a String received over RSB has to be parsed as an XIO line.
        Returns:
        true if RSB-Strings has to be parsed as XIO-lines, false otherwise.

      • getRSBDefaultInformerScope

        public java.lang.String getRSBDefaultInformerScope()
        Returns the default scope that is used by RSB informers, when sensor slots (or scopes) are not predefined, but created dynamically.
        Returns:
        String with default scope for RSB informers

      • getQueueCapacity

        public int getQueueCapacity()
        Returns the capacity of the delayed queue that holds the data read from source, before it is passed on to the target. The integer is the maximum number of events that can be stored in the queue.
        Returns:
        queue capacity (maximum number of events)

      • getBufferCapacity

        public int getBufferCapacity()
        Returns the capacity of the disk reader buffer. This is the maximum number of events that the buffer can store, while reading from a log file.
        Returns:
        capacity of disk reader buffer (maximum number of events)

      • getBufferThreshold

        public int getBufferThreshold()
        Returns the threshold for the disk reader buffer. If fewer events left in the buffer than the threshold, the buffer will be shifted.
        Returns:
        threshold for shifting the disk reader buffer

      • getBufferMinimumSkipAmount

        public long getBufferMinimumSkipAmount()
        Returns the minimum of bytes that will be skipped while searching a specific position in the log file (if source is DISK). If the search distance is smaller than this minimum, the disk reader will switch to line-by-line reading, instead of doing 'jumps'.
        Returns:
        minimum number of bytes that can be skipped, before switching to line-by-line reading (for disk reader)

      • getNumOfLinesToEstBPSFromReplay

        public int getNumOfLinesToEstBPSFromReplay()
        Returns the number of lines that should be used to estimate the byte-per-second (BPS) ratio of a replay file. The disk reader will read at maximum this number of lines and then calculates the BPS. The BPS value is used to calculate the size of the 'jumps', when searching a far position in the log file.
        Returns:
        maximum number of lines to be used for estimating the byte-per-second value for the replay file

      • getToSmallProgress

        public double getToSmallProgress()
        Returns the progress value that is to small to continue 'jumping' while searching a specific position in the replay file. While the disk reader is searching for the demanded timestamp in the replay file, it will make 'jumps' to be faster. After each jump the progress is calculated, to make any further jumps more precise (and of course to see if the target position is reached). But if the progress is so small, that it gives no speed advantage, than the disk reader will switch back to line-by-line reading.

      • getBigEnoughProgress

        public double getBigEnoughProgress()
        Returns the progress value that is big enough to re-calculate the BPS (byte-per-second) value for the replay file. The initial BPS value is an estimation, based on the first lines of the replay file. But while 'jumping' through the file in search for a specific timestamp, the disk reader gets more information about the density of the file, so it can calculate a more precise value for the area where the searched timestamp 'lives'.

      • isNoRPC

        public boolean isNoRPC()
        Returns true if RPC (remote-procedure-call) is disabled. Be default RPC is enabled when source is DISK.
        Returns:
        true if RPC connection is disabled, false otherwise

      • getRPCServerAddress

        Returns the port for the RPC-Server.

      • getClassMatchFile

        public java.lang.String getClassMatchFile()
        Returns the name of the file with class matching definitions. Class matching is used by RSB-IIO-modes, to translate events from one protocol to the other.
        Returns:
        name of file with class matching definitions

      • setClassMatchFile

        public void setClassMatchFile(java.lang.String filename)
        Sets the name of the file with class matching definitions. Class matching is used by RSB-IIO-modes, to translate events from one protocol to the other.
        Parameters:
        name - of file with class matching definitions

      • setXioCodesFilename

        Set a name for a file containing XML definitions of a mapping between XIO tag names and data types.
        Parameters:

      • readSlotFile

        public void readSlotFile()
        Reads and parses the slot file. Used for predefining slots. Be sure to call this AFTER loading all external classes (e.g. protobuf) and adding XIO codes to XIOMaps.
        If done to early, some types will not be recognized.

      • writeRaw

        public boolean writeRaw()
        Should data be written uncompressed to disk?
        Returns:
        true if data should be written in raw form (instead of compressed form)

        public boolean isMaxPrio()
